item.title: One single cigarette reduces your life expectancy by 20 minutes, finds study - India TV News
item.description:
One Single Cigarette Reduces Life Expectancy by 20 Minutes, Study Reveals

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 Source: India TV News

A recent study conducted by researchers from the University College of London found that smoking one single cigarette can reduce the life expectancy of an individual by 20 minutes on average.

  • The study published in the Journal of Addiction indicates that men lose an average of 17 minutes and women 22 minutes of life expectancy per cigarette.
  • If a person smoking 10 cigarettes a day quits, they could recover a full day of life by January 8, and potentially a week by February 5.
  • Individuals could regain 50 days of life by avoiding smoking throughout the year.
  • Smokers are advised to quit completely to gain health benefits and reduce risks of heart disease and stroke by nearly 50%.
Dr. Sarah Jackson stated, "On average, smokers who don’t quit lose around a decade of life. That’s 10 years of precious time, life moments, and milestones with loved ones."

The study emphasizes that quitting smoking at any age is beneficial for improving life expectancy and health outcomes.

item.title: Why do women have high pain tolerance? Is it a healthy trait? - The Times of India
item.description:
Why do women have high pain tolerance? Is it a healthy trait?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Research indicates that women may have higher pain tolerance than men, prompting the question of whether this trait is advantageous or detrimental to their health.

  • Women experience pain differently than men, often reporting higher tolerance levels.
  • Biological factors, including hormonal influences, may play a role in pain perception.
  • The implications of high pain tolerance on women’s health are explored.
"Understanding how women perceive pain can lead to better treatment options and health outcomes."

Research into women's pain tolerance sheds light on critical physiological and psychological differences, influencing healthcare approaches.

item.title: 10 Morning Yoga Asanas To Boost Healthy Cholesterol Levels - TheHealthSite
item.description:
10 Morning Yoga Asanas To Boost Healthy Cholesterol Levels

Publication Date: Not provided Source: The Health Site

Are you worried about your heart health and high cholesterol levels? Try these 10 yoga asanas to boost good cholesterol (HDL) levels in the body naturally.

  • Mountain Pose (Tadasana) - Promotes balance and reduces stress.
  • Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana) - Boosts blood flow and calms the mind.
  • Warrior II (Virabhadrasana II) - Builds strength and promotes circulation.
  • Bridge Pose (Setu Bandhasana) - Opens the chest and enhances lung capacity.
  • Cat-Cow Stretch (Marjaryasana-Bitilasana) - Improves flexibility and circulation.
  • Seated Forward Bend (Paschimottanasana) - Promotes relaxation and supports digestion.
  • Cobra Pose (Bhujangasana) - Strengthens the spine and opens the heart area.
  • Child's Pose (Balasana) - Encourages relaxation and reduces cortisol levels.
  • Legs-Up-The-Wall Pose (Viparita Karani) - Encourages relaxation and combats fatigue.
  • Corpse Pose (Savasana) - Fosters deep relaxation and mindfulness.

Try the above asanas to control your LDL cholesterol levels and keep the heart healthy and happy!

item.title: Winter and heart attacks: How cold waves increase cardiovascular and stroke risks? Experts explain - Indiatimes.com
item.description:
Winter and heart attacks: How cold waves increase cardiovascular and stroke risks? Experts explain

Publication Date: January 2023 Source: Indiatimes

The article examines how cold weather affects heart health, increasing the risk of cardiovascular events such as heart attacks and strokes, particularly in vulnerable individuals.

  • Cold temperatures can constrict blood vessels, raising blood pressure.
  • Increased risk of blood clot formation which may lead to stroke.
  • People with existing conditions such as high blood pressure and diabetes are at greater risk.
  • Vitamin D deficiency in winter contributes to cardiovascular issues.
  • Preventive measures include maintaining a healthy lifestyle and being aware of stroke warning signs.
“This can increase your blood pressure. This added pressure on your heart can heighten the risk of experiencing complications like heart attacks or even strokes...” - Dr. Anand Ram

It's crucial to take extra care of heart health during winter months, especially for those with pre-existing conditions, to mitigate risks associated with cold weather.

item.title: ‘Hydration, exercise, fibre’: Experts share key mantras to maintain gut health this winter - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Hydration, exercise, fibre’: Experts share key mantras to maintain gut health this winter

Publication Date: Not provided

Source: Indian Express

Constipation is a common gastrointestinal issue that often worsens in winter. Experts suggest hydration, exercise, and a high-fiber diet to manage and prevent this condition.

  • Hydration: Drink over two litres of fluids daily to aid digestion and maintain bowel movement.
  • Regular Exercise: Engage in physical activity to promote bowel movements.
  • Fibre Intake: Consume at least 30 grams of dietary fibre daily from natural food sources like fruits and vegetables.
  • Prebiotics and Probiotics: Foods like oats, bananas, and fermented items boost gut health.
  • Medical Attention: Seek help if constipation is accompanied by severe symptoms.
“Consume at least 30 grams of dietary fibre daily (e.g., one avocado and one pear cover 50 percent of this requirement).” - Dr. Arvind Sahni

In conclusion, maintaining gut health during winter requires a proactive approach with hydration, dietary choices, and regular exercise.

item.title: Cancer vaccines are showing promise at last | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Title: Cancer vaccines are showing promise at last

Date: Not specified, Source: Mint

Towards the end of the 19th century, William Coley, a surgeon in New York, observed that a patient with a neck tumour recovered after contracting a bacterial skin infection. This discovery led to the concept of cancer vaccines, which aim to train the immune system to recognize and fight tumours. After decades of trial and error, promising results are now emerging from various clinical trials.

  1. Coley's observation and initial experiments
  2. Widespread acceptance of Coley's idea in the 1950s
  3. Current cancer vaccine trials against various types of cancer
  4. Emerging promising results from these trials
After half a century of disappointing dead ends, promising results are starting to emerge.

The article highlights the potential of cancer vaccines and how they could revolutionize cancer treatment.

item.title: Meet woman, who left high-paying private job, battled serious health ailments,Â cracked UPSC - DNA India
item.description:
Meet Pratibha Verma: From Corporate Employee to IAS Officer Despite Health Challenges

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 Source: DNA India

Pratibha Verma's story is one of grit and determination, transcending her humble beginnings in Sultanpur, Uttar Pradesh, to become an IAS officer after overcoming significant health challenges.

  • Initially worked in a high-paying job in the telecom sector.
  • Faced health issues including dengue and typhoid during her UPSC preparation.
  • Achieved AIR 489 in her second attempt and secured AIR 3 in her third attempt.
  • Utilized the COVID-19 lockdown to sharpen her focus and prepare for the UPSC exam.
“Her story reflects perseverance in the face of illness and chaos.”

Pratibha Verma's journey showcases that with determination and resilience, one can achieve extraordinary goals despite life's hurdles.

item.title: 5 Shocking Health Risks of Oversleeping - Mint
item.description:
5 Shocking Health Risks of Oversleeping

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 Source: Mint

Sleeping more than 10 hours a night is considered oversleeping and can negatively impact your health.

  • Weight Gain: Oversleeping is linked to higher BMI and weight gain due to a sedentary lifestyle.
  • Infertility: Research shows that oversleeping can decrease the likelihood of getting pregnant.
  • Type 2 Diabetes: Sleeping more than eight hours per night raises the risk of type 2 diabetes by 2.5 times.
  • Heart Diseases: Ten or more hours of sleep is associated with a significantly higher risk of death from heart-related conditions.
  • Depression: Oversleeping may indicate underlying mental health issues, with 15% of those with depression sleeping excessively.
"Sleeping ten hours or more is associated with a 56% higher risk of death from stroke."

It is crucial to maintain a balanced sleep schedule for better overall health.

item.title: Norovirus cases surge in USA: 5 key things you need to know - The Times of India
item.description:
Norovirus cases surge in USA: 5 key things you need to know

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Norovirus cases have seen a sharp increase in the USA, raising concerns among health officials and the public alike. Understanding the nature of this surge is crucial for prevention and awareness.

  • The number of reported norovirus cases in the USA has increased significantly.
  • Health officials emphasize the importance of hygiene in preventing the virus's spread.
  • The article outlines common symptoms of norovirus, which include vomiting, diarrhea, and stomach cramps.
  • Sharing hygiene tips to combat the virus is recommended to help keep communities safe.
  • Studies indicate seasonal spikes in norovirus cases, often during winter months.
“Maintaining proper hygiene is essential to prevent norovirus outbreaks.”

This surge in norovirus cases highlights the importance of public health education and personal responsibility in maintaining hygiene to mitigate outbreaks.

item.title: Struggling to lose weight? It's time to rethink what you drink - The Times of India
item.description:
Struggling to lose weight? It's time to rethink what you drink

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

This article discusses how beverages may hinder or help weight loss efforts, emphasizing the importance of re-evaluating what you drink in pursuit of healthier habits.

  • Many people overlook the caloric content of beverages in their weight loss journey.
  • Choosing lower-calorie drinks can significantly contribute to overall calorie reduction.
  • Hydration plays a key role in weight management.
"The choice of drink can be as important as the choice of food when it comes to managing weight."

In conclusion, by reassessing liquid diets and opting for more nutritious drink options, individuals can improve their weight loss results.

item.title: Chikungunya patients back in care as symptoms linger - The Times of India
item.description:
Chikungunya Patients Back in Care as Symptoms Linger

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

This article discusses how patients recovering from Chikungunya continue to experience lingering symptoms, necessitating ongoing medical care and attention.

  • Patients face prolonged joint pain and fatigue even after initial recovery.
  • Healthcare providers emphasize the importance of monitoring these patients.
  • Some patients report they require pain management and rehabilitation services.
“It’s as if the virus stays in the body longer than we expect,” says a healthcare professional.

The persistence of symptoms in Chikungunya patients highlights the need for more research and improved patient management strategies.

item.title: Greater Coffee and Tea Consumption Linked to Lower Risk of Head and Neck Cancer - Cancer Therapy Advisor
item.description:
Study: Daily Coffee and Tea Consumption Linked to Lower Head and Neck Cancer Risk

Published on: [Date] by [Source]

Drinking coffee or tea daily may reduce the risk of developing head and neck cancer, according to research published in Cancer.

Researchers found that drinking more than 4 cups of caffeinated coffee daily was associated with a lower risk of head and neck cancer overall, oral cavity cancer, and oropharyngeal cancer. Drinking 3-4 cups of caffeinated coffee daily was linked to a lower risk of hypopharyngeal cancer. Additionally, tea drinkers had a lower risk of hypopharyngeal cancer, and consuming up to 1 cup of tea daily was associated with a lower risk of head and neck cancer.

  1. Caffeinated coffee consumption of more than 4 cups daily linked to lower risk of head and neck cancer overall.
  2. Caffeinated coffee consumption linked to lower risk of oral cavity and oropharyngeal cancers.
  3. Tea consumption linked to lower risk of hypopharyngeal cancer.
“A dose-response relationship was observed across increasing levels of daily caffeinated coffee drinking for head and neck cancer, oral cavity, oropharyngeal, hypopharyngeal, and laryngeal cancers.”

The study was supported by the National Cancer Institute, and the authors reported no conflicts of interest.

item.title: Climbing stairs is as effective as walking 10,000 steps, says new study - The Times of India
item.description:
Climbing stairs is as effective as walking 10,000 steps, says new study

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

This article discusses a recent study that reveals climbing stairs provides the same health benefits as walking 10,000 steps daily, challenging common perceptions about exercise.

  • Climbing stairs is shown to enhance cardiovascular health.
  • The study suggests that stair climbing may offer a time-efficient alternative to lengthy walks.
  • Experts recommend incorporating more stairs into daily routines for improved fitness.
“Integrating stair climbing into your day can significantly boost physical activity levels,” said the study's lead researcher.

This study underscores the importance of diverse physical activities and encourages individuals to find practical ways to enhance their exercise regimens.

item.title: 5 Vitamin B 12 deficiency symptoms in hands and feet - India.com
item.description:
5 Vitamin B12 Deficiency Symptoms in Hands and Feet

Date: 01 Jan, 2025 | Source: India.com

This article discusses the common symptoms of Vitamin B12 deficiency that can manifest in the hands and feet, shedding light on a crucial health concern.

  • Numbness or tingling in extremities.
  • Difficulty walking or maintaining balance.
  • Weakness in the arms and legs.
  • Pale or jaundiced skin.
  • Mental changes like memory loss.
"Addressing Vitamin B12 deficiency is crucial for maintaining nerve health and overall well-being." - Jigyasa Sahay

Understanding Vitamin B12 deficiency symptoms can help in early diagnosis and treatment, preventing long-term health issues.

item.title: Researchers find concerning mutation in H5N1 bird flu found in Canadian teen - The Times of India
item.description:
Researchers find concerning mutation in H5N1 bird flu found in Canadian teen

Date: 2023-10-25 Source: Health News Daily

This article discusses the discovery of a significant mutation in the H5N1 bird flu virus in a Canadian teenager, raising concerns about its potential implications for public health.

  • The mutation may increase the virus's transmissibility among mammals.
  • Health officials are monitoring the situation closely given the pandemic implications.
  • The teenager is reported to be recovering, but the case has prompted further investigation.
“This mutation could pose a serious risk if it adapts to human-to-human transmission.” - Lead Researcher

The findings highlight the need for vigilance regarding influenza virus mutations and emerging health threats.

item.title: I Was Diagnosed With Stage 4 Hodgkin’s Lymphoma In My 20s: What Are the Unusual Signs Of the Cancer the Youngs - Times Now
item.description:
Georgie Swallow's Journey with Stage 4 Hodgkin’s Lymphoma: Recognizing the Unusual Signs

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Surrey Live

In her late 20s, Georgie Swallow from London was diagnosed with stage 4 Hodgkin’s lymphoma. Initially, she overlooked symptoms like fatigue, night sweats, and itchy legs, attributing them to lifestyle factors.

  • Georgie Swallow ignored extreme stress and constant tiredness.
  • She experienced symptoms like itchy legs, belly pain, and night sweats.
  • Her diagnosis required an aggressive treatment plan including chemotherapy and a stem cell transplant.
  • Hodgkin’s lymphoma is a rare but treatable blood cancer affecting the lymphatic system.
  • Awareness and early detection are crucial for better outcomes.
Georgie stated, “My treatment was very aggressive as I was stage 4.”

Georgie is now committed to raising awareness about the disease and encouraging others to recognize these symptoms early.

item.title: 8 ways to reduce uric acid in your body - The Times of India
item.description:
8 Ways to Reduce Uric Acid in Your Body

Publication Date: Jan 1, 2025 | Source: Times of India

Excess uric acid can lead to gout, kidney stones, and inflammation in joints. Here are eight effective strategies to manage uric acid levels:

  • Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water.
  • Limit purine-rich foods, such as red meat and seafood.
  • Maintain a healthy weight.
  • Include cherries and Vitamin C-rich foods in your diet.
  • Avoid sugary beverages and processed foods.
  • Opt for low-fat dairy products.
  • Avoid alcohol, especially beer and spirits.
“Managing uric acid levels is crucial for overall health.”

This article emphasizes the importance of diet and hydration in keeping uric acid in check, which can prevent serious health issues like gout.
